structure.unit: OFFENSES RELATING TO FIREARMS AND WEAPONS

law.catch_line: Use of a weapon of mass destruction in the first degree.

text.section: A person is guilty of use of a weapon of mass destruction in the first degree when he or she intentionally, without lawful authority, places a weapon of mass destruction at any location in the Commonwealth and, as a result, any person other than the defendant is killed or receives serious physical injury.

A weapon of mass destruction is used with lawful authority if it is used with the written permission of an agency of the Commonwealth or of a city, county, charter county, or urban-county government having jurisdiction over the use of destructive devices as defined in KRS 237.030 or the use of explosives.
Use of a weapon of mass destruction in the first degree is a Class A felony unless a person other than the defendant is killed as a result, in which case it is a capital offense.

law.history: Created 2001 Ky. Acts ch. 113, sec. 4, effective June 21, 2001.
